rules: Rule1: Either the researcher uses alcohol or the researcher is government funded.
Rule2: Whenever the researcher discovers a gene, the researcher develops techniques.
Rule3: Under the condition that the researcher publishes papers, the researcher presents findings.
Rule4: Provided that the researcher develops techniques, the researcher patents methods.
Rule5: Whenever the researcher develops techniques, the researcher commercializes discoveries.
Rule6: If the researcher collaborates academically, then the researcher patents methods implies that the researcher publishes papers.
Rule7: Either the researcher collaborates academically or the researcher collaborates with industry.
Rule8: If the researcher has skill in biotechnology, then the researcher operates a sequencer.
Rule9: Either the researcher has skill in biotechnology or the researcher has skill in wet lab techniques.
Rule10: If the researcher collaborates with industry, then the researcher patents methods implies that the researcher publishes papers.
Rule11: Either the researcher uses artificial intelligence or, if the researcher operates a sequencer, then the researcher analyzes DNA.
Rule12: Under the condition that the researcher follows protocols, the researcher does not use artificial intelligence.
Rule13: Either the researcher works safely or the researcher follows ethics.
Rule14: Provided that the researcher follows ethics, the researcher follows protocols.
Rule15: If the researcher maintains records, then either the researcher violates guidelines or, if the researcher works safely, then the researcher follows protocols.
Rule16: Provided that the researcher documents procedures, the researcher maintains records.
Rule17: If the researcher has skill in wet lab techniques, then the researcher does not use alcohol.
Rule18: Either the researcher focuses on biochemistry or the researcher focuses on genetics.
Rule19: Provided that the researcher focuses on genetics, the researcher studies metabolism implies that the researcher identifies enzymes.
Rule20: If the researcher contradicts a hypothesis, then the researcher confirms a hypothesis.
Rule21: Under the condition that the researcher contradicts a hypothesis, the researcher does not confirm a hypothesis.
Rule22: If the researcher misuses equipment, then the researcher does not use alcohol.
Rule23: Either the researcher misuses equipment or the researcher mishandles samples.
Rule24: If the researcher uses outdated technology, then the researcher does not contaminate experiments.
Rule25: Either the researcher uses outdated technology or the researcher ignores calibration.
Rule26: Provided that the researcher operates a sequencer, the researcher processes samples.
Rule27: If the researcher neglects maintenance, then the researcher ignores calibration implies that the researcher does not contaminate experiments.
Rule28: Either the researcher neglects maintenance or the researcher skips quality control.
Rule29: Provided that the researcher skips quality control, the researcher ignores calibration implies that the researcher does not contaminate experiments.
Rule30: Either the researcher modifies protocols or the researcher deviates from standards.
Rule31: Provided that the researcher deviates from standards, the researcher does not conduct experiments.
Rule32: Whenever the researcher optimizes processes, the researcher does not conduct experiments.
Rule33: If the researcher achieves breakthroughs, then the researcher wins awards.
Rule34: Either the researcher achieves breakthroughs or, if the researcher modifies protocols, then the researcher optimizes processes.
Rule35: Under the condition that the researcher analyzes DNA, the researcher does not use alcohol.
Rule36: If the researcher synthesizes compounds, then the researcher characterizes molecules.
Rule37: Either the researcher synthesizes compounds or the researcher purifies substances.
Rule38: Under the condition that the researcher purifies substances, the researcher does not complete studies.
Rule39: If the researcher applies spectroscopy, then the researcher characterizes molecules implies that the researcher does not complete studies.
Rule40: Either the researcher applies spectroscopy or the researcher uses chromatography.
Rule41: Under the condition that the researcher uses chromatography, the researcher validates results.
Rule42: Whenever the researcher determines structures, the researcher characterizes molecules implies that the researcher does not complete studies.
Rule43: If the researcher peer reviews, then the researcher validates results implies that the researcher determines structures.
Rule44: Provided that the researcher forms startups, the researcher secures funding.
Rule45: Whenever the researcher forms startups, the researcher does not secure funding.
Rule46: Either the researcher shares data or, if the researcher patents methods, then the researcher publishes papers.
Rule47: Either the researcher publishes open access or, if the researcher protects intellectual property, then the researcher does not share data.
Rule48: If the researcher pursues patents, then the researcher innovates methods implies that the researcher faces competition.
Rule49: Either the researcher pursues patents or the researcher licenses technology.
Rule50: Provided that the researcher generates revenue, the researcher innovates methods implies that the researcher faces competition.
Rule51: If the researcher is trained in molecular biology, then the researcher processes samples implies that the researcher analyzes DNA.
Rule52: Provided that the researcher establishes companies, the researcher scales technology.
Rule53: Whenever the researcher scales technology, the researcher licenses technology implies that the researcher generates revenue.
Rule54: If the researcher works with animals, then the researcher tests on animals.
Rule55: Either the researcher works with animals or the researcher is government funded.
Rule56: Provided that the researcher conducts experiments, the researcher completes studies.
Rule57: Either the researcher conducts experiments or the researcher does not work with animals.
Rule58: Provided that it is not the case that either the researcher attends conferences or the researcher is government funded, the researcher discovers a gene.
Rule59: Under the condition that it is not the case that the researcher develops techniques implies that the researcher publishes papers, the researcher innovates methods.
Rule60: Whenever it is not the case that the researcher develops techniques implies that the researcher publishes papers, the researcher does not face competition.
Rule61: If it is not the case that the researcher has skill in biotechnology implies that the researcher does not use alcohol, then the researcher studies metabolism.

Rule62: Provided that it is not the case that the researcher focuses on biochemistry implies that the researcher studies metabolism implies that the researcher identifies enzymes, the researcher contradicts a hypothesis.
Rule63: Under the condition that it is not the case that the researcher mishandles samples implies that the researcher does not use alcohol, the researcher contaminates experiments.
Rule64: If it is not the case that the researcher tests on animals implies that the researcher gets approval, then the researcher faces scrutiny.
Rule65: Provided that it is not the case that the researcher tests on animals implies that the researcher gets approval, the researcher does not face scrutiny.
Rule66: Whenever it is not the case that the researcher commercializes discoveries implies that the researcher publishes papers, the researcher forms startups.

Rule67: Under the condition that it is not the case that not the researcher conducts experiments implies that the researcher gets funding implies that the researcher writes proposals, the researcher submits grants.

Rule68: Provided that it is not the case that not the researcher conducts experiments implies that the researcher gets funding implies that the researcher writes proposals, the researcher does not submit grants.
Rule69: If the researcher does not document procedures, then the researcher loses data.
facts: Fact2: The researcher protects intellectual property.
Fact3: The researcher is trained in molecular biology.
Fact5: It is not the case that the researcher gets funding.
Fact6: The researcher does not write proposals.
Fact7: The researcher does not attend conferences.
Fact8: It is not the case that the researcher presents findings.
Fact9: It is not the case that the researcher violates guidelines.
Fact10: The researcher does not lose data.
Fact11: The researcher does not identify enzymes.
Fact12: The researcher does not win awards.
Fact13: The researcher does not get approval.
Fact14: The researcher does not publish open access.
